thread.title: Comment on Browns reportedly have interest in Geno Smith, potentially as a starter by dawgturd
thread.title_full: Comment on Browns reportedly have interest in Geno Smith, potentially as a starter by dawgturd

author: dawgturd
title: Comment on Browns reportedly have interest in Geno Smith, potentially as a starter by dawgturd
text:
Mar 14, 2017 6:05 AM 
Ladies and gentlemen, the Cleveland Browns. avenger9800 says: Mar 14, 2017 6:05 AM 
If Hue has Geno as his starting QB after the RGlll experiment, then he’s not the QB whisper everyone says he is. The Browns may as well just move on with Gregg Williams as the head coach! Mar 14, 2017 6:08 AM 
hahahahahahahahahahahahahaha 
is it april fools day already…. 
what a bunch of morons ace24xx says: Mar 14, 2017 6:12 AM 
Hahahahaha Mar 14, 2017 6:12 AM 
The Sadness Factory is in full production Mar 14, 2017 6:14 AM 
Too funny, and this why Clevrland are the Browns. poison66 says: Mar 14, 2017 6:19 AM 
Oswieler the starter in 201!, I can’t wait to lmao at the Brownies again Mar 14, 2017 6:21 AM 
If that is there three choices he is probably their best option. It would be ironic if he did well there and the Jets sign Josh McCown. joedirte4life says: Mar 14, 2017 6:23 AM 
They must really want that USC QB next year rowech44 says: Mar 14, 2017 6:24 AM 
If I’m a Browns fan, especially a season ticket holder, I wouldn’t be happy to hear a Jets castaway could be the next starting QB… let’s hear from some Browns fans – What do you think they should offer Pats for Jimmy G to try to get it done??? Would you mind seeing the #1 pick go??? I’m curious to hear some Browns fans opinions on the issue… uopclod says: Mar 14, 2017 6:24 AM 
Geno Smith… $1MM talent with a 10 cent head. If he only had a brain. officialgame says: Mar 14, 2017 6:25 AM 
The amount of press the Cleveland Browns get every off season is ridicules. Who cares? Until proven otherwise the way they go about team building is flat out stupid. They passed on Carson Wentz for what amounted to an extra #1 pick and bragged about it afterwards. Still without a QB they come up with a guy who is not only a lousy QB but a bad person to boot. Mar 14, 2017 6:29 AM 
Wow dawgturd says: Mar 14, 2017 6:30 AM 
Low risk high reward move. Sign him, let him compete, he probably won’t make the final roster anyway, but what’s the harm in seeing what he’s got? Leave a Reply
